Spinal cord dorsal horn substantia gelat.Definition: Neuron found in the substantia gelatinosa (Rexed lamina II) of spinal cord, with perikarya situated along the superficial border of layer II. Most of their dendrites traveled ventrally while spreading out rostrocaudally, giving their dendritic arbors a fan-like shape. Stalked cell axons arborized largely in layer I.  Cell soma size ranged from 16 to 22 pm
